metadata.title: Animal sales from Wuhan wet markets immediately prior to the COVID-19 pandemic

body_text.text: List of 38 species sold in Wuhan City markets from May 2017-Nov 2019, of which thirty-three have been reportedly infected with zoonotic pathogens in wild populations, markets and/or farms in China since 2009. Note: The masked palm civet (Paguma larvata) was the host involved in the 2003 SARS outbreak*.
Zoonotic pathogens found in wild populations

Zoonotic pathogens found in farmed hosts Mammals Raccoon dog (Nyctereutes procyonoides) Enterocytozoon bieneusi (Yang et al. 2015) , H5N1 Influenza (Qi et al. 2009 ), Arctic-like rabies virus (Shao et al. 2011) , Toxoplasma gondii (Zheng et al. 2017) , Carnivore amdoparvovirus (Shao et al. 2014 ), canine distemper virus (Zhao et al. 2010; Cheng et al. 2015) , Enterocytozoon bieneusi (Xu et al. 2016 Chen, R., Lin, X., Hu, L., Chen, X., Tang, Y., Zhang, J., …& Huang, C. (2015) . Genetic characterization of Toxoplasma gondii from zoo wildlife and pet birds in Fujian, China. Iranian journal of parasitology, 10(4), 663.
